page.title: 01A summary of our area
page.content: The villages in our area are Marton le Moor, Skelton on Ure and Kirby Hill. The A1 separates Kirby Hill in the east from Marton and Skelton in the west. In between the villages is farmland with winding country lanes. Although the names refer to hill and moor the land is only gently sloped. Kirby Hill is about 22 metres above sea level and the highest point near Marton le Moor is 53 metres. Kirby Hill is the largest village and has many housesbuilt in the last thirty years. Skelton is an estate village, there has been little development and many of the properties are owned by the estate. Marton is the smallest village. The whole area is part of the Borough of Harrogate.
